info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 11:36AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT HARRISON...JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...EASTERN CARROLL...NORTH CENTRAL BELMONT... BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 1135 AM EST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from Wellsville to 11 miles southeast of Carrollton to 6 miles east of Freeport. These showers could drop visibility to less than half a mile and produce a quick 1 to 1.5 inches of snow. Movement was east at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Wellsville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Wellsburg, Freeport, and Economy. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 19 and 22. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 46. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
